intro: Cervaria alsatica var. luteola, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Crambe, characterized by its small, showy flowers and succulent stems. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in early spring, are clustered in dense inflorescences. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
